Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of expression as outlined in Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The bill allows the government to define 'truth', leading to potential state-imposed censorship.
The legislation could lead to a double standard where government and mainstream media are exempt from scrutiny.
The bill empowers ACMA to subjectively determine misinformation, which could suppress public debate and diverse opinions.
Censorship is not an effective solution to misinformation and could exacerbate the problem.
Notable Quotes: How can we possibly have freedom of expression if we canâ€™t express an opinion that the government has deemed to be 'misinformation'?
This bill is going to allow State-imposed 'truth'.
The Bill effectively enables tech companies to become tools of government censorship, stifling free speech and undermining the open exchange of ideas.
Censorship never solves a misinformation or disinformation problem.
